Public Health

Degree

BS in Public Health

School

Nursing and Health Sciences

Department

Public Health

At a Glance

Gain the knowledge and skills to promote, protect, and improve health and wellness across families, communities, and cultures. In this dynamic and engaging program, you’ll become equipped as a public health advocate to follow your passion in a varied and growing range of professions. From medicine to marketing and epidemiology to public policy, there are many opportunities to lead change in human health. You’ll benefit from our emphasis on global perspectives, cross-cultural competency, and intensive experiential learning that offers flexibility for customized study.

ApplyRequest Info

Undergraduate Program Options

MAJOR

Public Health, BS

MINOR

Public Health Minor

Accelerated/Dual-Degree Program Option

Get a jumpstart and enter the workforce with a master’s degree. Accelerated options get you there faster and more affordably through fewer semesters of classes. Dual degrees offer a streamlined path to earning two degrees, often with direct admission to the graduate portion.
Public Health + Master of Public Health, BS/MPH

You’ll Benefit From:

  • A curriculum customizable to your goals, with courses from all seven TCNJ schools
  • Accommodation for double majors, self-designed majors, minors, and electives
  • Accelerated TCNJ degree options and graduate certificate programs
  • Opportunities for faculty-mentored research and community engagement projects
  • Resume-building capstone internships with intensive experiential education
  • Sponsorship for professional conferences
  • Study abroad programs and faculty-led study abroad tours focused on global health
  • Deep preparation and mentoring for graduate and professional programs
  • Access to state-of-the-art facilities and specialized software
  • One-on-one advising from dedicated faculty
  • Access to a strong network of alumni public health professionals

Careers

There is tremendous opportunity in public health. You’ll graduate with the knowledge and skills to excel in multiple settings, disciplines, and professions as you launch your career or pursue further studies. Public health professionals may analyze data, coordinate social services, design media campaigns, allocate financial resources, manage community health programs, craft effective public policy, and guide patient care and education.

TCNJ public health alumni work as public health consultants, certified health education specialists, epidemiologists, communication specialists, clinical research coordinators, and leaders of health departments. Our students routinely land job placements by the spring of their graduating year.

Recent Employers

Health departments (local, county, and state)
Johnson & Johnson / Janssen
Pharmaceuticals
Memorial Sloan Kettering
Merck
RWJBarnabas Health

Recent Graduate Programs

Columbia University
Emory University
Johns Hopkins University
Rutgers University
The College of New Jersey

Course Sequence

Students can design a custom curriculum that draws on courses from all seven TCNJ schools to support any career goal. Intensive capstone internships, providing 120 hours of on-site experiential education in an approved public health setting, ensure our graduates start their careers with an outstanding college portfolio.

Internships and Service

Public health students intern, volunteer, and serve during most semesters at TCNJ, and all have to complete a capstone project as part of their graduation requirements.

Students have found placements in hospitals and clinics (Robert Wood Johnson University Hospital, Penn Medicine, Children’s Hospital of Philadelphia, MD Anderson Cancer Center at Cooper, the Atlantic Health System, Henry J Austin Health Center); health departments (New Jersey State Health Department, Princeton Health Department, Hopewell Health Department, Lawrence Health Department, Philadelphia Health Department, Monmouth County Health Department, New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene); nonprofit organizations (National Alliance on Mental Illness of Mercer County, Trenton Health Team, Arm in Arm, KinderSmile Foundation); global pharmaceutical companies (Pfizer, Sanofi, Janssen/J&J, Bristol Myers Squibb); and leading public health state-wide organizations (New Jersey Public Health Association, NJ YMCA State Alliance).

Students interested in global health have interned abroad in Ghana, Panama, South Africa, Israel, and Poland. Several global opportunities are currently available, including positions with our partner site, Pravara Institute of Medical Sciences, in Loni, India.

Faculty

Public health faculty enthusiastically share their rich professional expertise, engaging students in experiential learning through interactive pedagogy and participation in leadership opportunities, including research, conferences, networking, global study, intensive internships, and mentoring.
